intro: Tolpis baetica, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Tolpis baetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also of interest in ecological studies due to its specific habitat requirements.
